SENT.plain: We report three cases of autopsy-proven Binswanger's disease (subcortical arteriosclerotic encephalopathy) with unusual clinical features
Two patients had supranuclear gaze disturbances, early gait dysfunction, and speech disorders suggestive of progressive supranuclear palsy
One of these patients was not demented at the time of death
The third patient had features typical of Parkinson's disease
All three patients were responsive to treatment with levodopa
The clinical spectrum of Binswanger's disease should be expanded to include levodopa-responsive parkinsonism
